Content is king, but format is queen.

Your content can be great, but if its not easy to consume, it won't be seen.

How can you improve your tweeting style?

By stealing from the best. 

A thread

2. Sell as service
3. Compile into product
4. Build once, sell twice

Could write a book on it so I'm not sure a tweet will do it justice, but how I did it:

Build a marketable skill you can sell as a service until you have time/money to experiment with product.

Then, consistently publish media that upgrades your network and moves product.

If it fails, you've got yourself a story

6 - It's a great sales channel

So stop planning. Start doing. And learn to appreciate the surprises along the way.

Why are 98,8% of threads looking the same lately?

If I had to build my audience all over again, here's what I'd do:

• Pick 2-3 core topics
• Talk about them online
• Connect with others with similar interests

And the most critical thing: 
Stick to it for long enough to see results.
